rComments: She's a really nice person but her expectations are unreasonable and a bit contradictory

Her and her class were great, I have taken HAVC 151 Greek Myths with ther too and absolutely loved it. Not necessarily an easy class but the final was take home. Course structure (similar to FILM ones): besides discussion section we had screening, movies were ending at 9:30 pm and most times mandatory, otherwise hard to find. Lots of reading

Maria is a great teacher for students new to the HAVC department, or for those who are really interested in history, art, and social change. There is a lot of class work however: a few different essays, section responses, and long reading assignments. But Maria is very kind, and teaches with a lot of passion about the material.

Even if you are not very interested on Greek myths you will find this class fascinating, the political approach was really accurate and she encourages participation in the class. You should do your readings on time and study every week at least to read your notes. She is very helpful and overall a very nice person. I highly recommend her class

Maria was wonderful! Participation is extra credit, and she constantly poses questions to the class for answers and discussion, which I loved. She's also the kindest, most helpful woman you'll ever meet. She brought in her PERSONAL books as resources for just me to burrow for MY research paper. She goes above and beyond for students. Take her! :)

Friendly, knowledgeable, helpful, and accommodating are just a few words to describe her. The material is interesting and Maria's analysis of it, combined with her daily encouraging of discussion in class make her lectures totally essential and quite the learning experience. eCommons was helpful for reviewing material, but take your own notes.

"HAVC 155: Constructing Cleopatra" is the best class I've ever taken at UCSC. Maria is wise, articulate, and passionate about the subject material. Her passion is infectious. You can tell she really cares for her students. The class does necessitate a decent amount of writing, but it's definitely worth the work. I definitely recommend this class.

Greek myths was amazing. The analysis I learned in this class I have applied to my life and in other fields (I am an engineering major). Maria is brilliant and articulate. She is also a caring person and she rewarded me for the effort I put into developing new ideas in this class. The TA and the review sessions were also very helpful.

such a wise woman. knowledge beyond just her subject. she goes on these tangents (every professor does, whatever) that are such aware and righteous life-lessons. not just one of my best professors but one of the most amazing people i've met.

Maria is such a sweet person. She makes you feel like any thing you have to say is a contribution to the class and NEVER wrong.She uploads all her notes so you should only take notes on what's not written but just talked about. She gives all the material you need to be prepare for the tests. :)

I swapped over to Maria's Greek Eyes class after a week into the quarter and I couldn't have made a better choice. She is the sweetest teacher and made my first quarter at UCSC wonderful. She is so helpful and gives a lot of studying material for the tests and papers. The class was so interesting and was worth every hour of studying and class time.

Maria is seriously one of the best teachers I've ever had, hands down. She made everything interesting and easy to understand. When I was confused, I wasn't afraid to raise my hand and ask questions, and she never made you feel stupid for speaking up and asking. My only complaint was that she wasn't very good at being brief when explaining things.
Awesome class, awesome professor.

Best professor I have ever had! She is so passionate and really goes above and beyond her job requirements to help you learn the material. She provides a lot of information but her tests are not too bad. Great professor, take any class you can with her! Her Islamic Art class is the best course I have ever taken!

Started off Freshman year with Maria's Greek Art class. First Art History class ever, and it was absolutely brilliant. I never bothered to read the textbook but attended the lectures and took notes and learned so much. She clearly loves the subject and just wants the class to learn.

One of the best courses I've ever taken, hands down best professor.  Everything about this class was fantastic, and it's so refreshing to see a professor who is so passionate about a subject and organized and prepared in giving lectures!
Maria is an extremely passionate and knowledgeable, fun professor. Very highly recommended for anybody with an interest in classical studies, antique art history, or Byzantinology.
Professor Evangelatou is amazingly passionate and changed the way that I view Greek art. Her ideas are eye-opening and while she moves quickly in lecture, it's easy to stay engaged.
She was a great teacher!

I absolutely love this teacher. She is extremely passionate in her work and really tries to make her students develop an understanding and passion about the topics. I have taken 3 different classes with her now and have learn an immense amount and enjoyed every moment of it. She does present a lot of info, but her lectures are amzing!

For Byzantine Art History:   She was really nice, and passionate about her subject, but unfortunately threw a ton of information at her students in lecture and in reading, and everything was always unclear and muddled. Her accent didn't help either.
